properties.name: singularity.app.base-url
properties.description: Base URL for the application. This is used to generate links in emails and other notifications.

properties.name: singularity.app.support-mail
properties.description: The email address that is used for support requests.

properties.name: singularity.app.name
properties.description: The name of the application. This is used in various places, including the UI and emails.

properties.name: singularity.app.create-root-user
properties.description: Should the application create a root user at application start?

properties.name: singularity.app.root-email
properties.description: The email associated to the root user.

properties.name: singularity.app.root-password
properties.description: The password associated to the root user.

properties.name: singularity.app.secure
properties.description: Enable HTTPS and secure cookies for the application. Default is false.

properties.name: singularity.app.enable-mail
properties.description: Enable mails for email verification, password resets, ...

properties.name: singularity.auth.admin-paths
properties.description: Paths that require users to be authenticated and to have the ADMIN role.

properties.name: singularity.auth.public-paths
properties.description: Paths that do not require authentication.

properties.name: singularity.auth.user-paths
properties.description: Paths that require users to be authenticated and to have the USER role.

properties.name: singularity.auth.allow-header-authentication
properties.description: Allow authentication using a bearer token placed in the header along HTTP-only Cookies. Allowed by default.

properties.name: singularity.auth.prefer-header-authentication
properties.description: If header authentication is allowed, this property controls the precedence: if true, the Authorization header is preferred over HTTP-only cookies.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.type
properties.description: The type of storage you prefer. Default is local.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.local.file-directory
properties.description: The directory where your private files will be stored.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.local.public-path
properties.description: The directory where your public files will be stored.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.domain
properties.description: The URI of your S3

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.scheme
properties.description: The scheme of your S3 URL. Can be http or https.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.bucket
properties.description: The bucket in your S3 storage.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.region
properties.description: The region of your S3 storage.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.access-key
properties.description: Your S3 access key.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.secret-key
properties.description: Your S3 secret key.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.signature-duration
properties.description: How many minutes should presigned URLs be valid? Default is 5 min.

properties.name: singularity.file.storage.s3.path-style-access-enabled
properties.description: Should the bucket be added as subdomain or inside the path. If enabled bucket.domain.com will become domain.com/bucket

properties.name: singularity.mail.debug
properties.description: Enable debug mode for email sending. This will log the email content to the console.

properties.name: singularity.mail.email
properties.description: The email address used to send emails. This is the 'from' address.

properties.name: singularity.mail.password
properties.description: The password for the email account used to send emails.

properties.name: singularity.mail.password-reset-expiration
properties.description: Expiration time for the password reset token in seconds. Default is 15 minutes.

properties.name: singularity.mail.password-reset-send-cooldown
properties.description: Cooldown period in seconds for sending password reset emails.

properties.name: singularity.mail.port
properties.description: The port used for sending emails. Default is 587.

properties.name: singularity.mail.smtp-auth
properties.description: Enable SMTP authentication for sending emails.

properties.name: singularity.mail.smtp-starttls
properties.description: Enable STARTTLS for secure email transmission.

properties.name: singularity.mail.transport-protocol
properties.description: The transport protocol used for sending emails. Default is 'smtp'.

properties.name: singularity.mail.username
properties.description: The username for the email account used to send emails.

properties.name: singularity.mail.verification-expiration
properties.description: Expiration time for the verification token in seconds. Default is 15 minutes.

properties.name: singularity.mail.verification-send-cooldown
properties.description: Cooldown period in seconds for sending verification emails.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.store
properties.description: The secret store you want to use. Default value is local.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.key-rotation-cron
properties.description: The cron expression for key rotation. The default value is the 1st day of January, April, July, and October at 4:00:00 AM.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.cache-expiration
properties.description: The duration it takes for cached secrets to expire in milliseconds. Default is 900 000ms which is equal to 15min.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.local.secret-directory
properties.description: The directory your secret db will be stored in.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.vault.scheme
properties.description: The scheme of your Vault vault instance. Can be http or https.

properties.name: singularity.secrets.vault.host
properties.description: The host of your Vault vault instance

properties.name: singularity.secrets.vault.port
properties.description: The port of your Vault vault instance

properties.name: singularity.secrets.vault.token
properties.description: The token to access your Vault vault instance

properties.name: singularity.secrets.vault.engine
properties.description: The engine that stores all secrets. Default is apps.

properties.name: singularity.security.jwt.expires-in
properties.description: Expiration time for the JWT token in seconds. Default is 15 minutes.

properties.name: singularity.security.rate-limit.ip-limit
properties.description: Maximum number of requests from a single IP address in the time window.

properties.name: singularity.security.rate-limit.ip-time-window
properties.description: Time window in minutes for the IP limit.

properties.name: singularity.security.rate-limit.user-limit
properties.description: Maximum number of requests per user in the time window.

properties.name: singularity.security.rate-limit.user-time-window
properties.description: Time window in minutes for the user limit.

properties.name: singularity.security.login-attempt-limit.ip-limit
properties.description: Maximum number of login attempts from a single IP address before being blocked.

properties.name: singularity.security.login-attempt-limit.ip-time-window
properties.description: Time window in minutes for the IP limit.

properties.name: singularity.security.two-factor.recovery-code-length
properties.description: Length of the recovery code. Default is 10 characters.

properties.name: singularity.security.two-factor.recovery-code-count
properties.description: Count of recovery codes to generate. Default is 6.

properties.name: singularity.ui.base-url
properties.description: Base URL for the UI application. This is used to generate links in emails and other notifications.

properties.name: singularity.ui.primary-color
properties.description: The primary UI color used in mail templates

properties.name: singularity.ui.password-reset-path
properties.description: The path to the password reset page in the UI application.

properties.name: singularity.ui.email-verification-path
properties.description: The path to the verification page in the UI application.
